intro: Justicia decussata, commonly known as the redstem false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of red, pink, or purple, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it suitable for borders, containers, or rock gardens.
